intro: Ouratea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Its showy white or pink flowers are arranged in umbellate clusters and bloom during the rainy season. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments.
